WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Request_Return_from_Leave_Event.description: The Worker for the Leave Return Request Event.
Contains date of worker's first day back to work.

validation.validation: First Day Back at Work must be after the Actual Last Day of Leave.

Leave_Request_EventObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Leave_Request_EventObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Leave_Request_EventObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Leaves_Returning_from_Data.description: Reference to an existing Leave of Absence Request

validation.validation: The "Request Leave of Absence Reference" must be for the employee specified in the "Employee Reference".
Return from Leave of Absence Requests can only be made to "Successfully Completed" but not yet returned from Request Leave of Absence Events.

Leaves_Returning_from_Data.description: A boolean value to determine if this web service request is a correction or add operation.

validation.validation: This Leave Event has not been returned yet. A correction for a return event cannot be processed until the Leave has been returned.
A correction cannot be processed without a comment.

Leaves_Returning_from_Data.description: The date (YYYY-MM-DD) value for the last day of leave.

validation.validation: Actual Last Day of Leave must be on or after the First Day of Leave.
Verify that the First Day of Leave and Actual Last Day of Leave are correct. A leave must be less than 50 years.

Request_Return_from_Leave_Event.description: Element containing the Request Return from Leave of Absence Data for an employee.

validation.validation: Workday didn't upload the events associated with the Request Leave of Absence ID [LEAVE_REQUEST_ID]. You can't have multiple events with the same Request Leave of Absence ID.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Request_Return_from_Leave_Event.description: Captures a comment for the Business Process.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Free form text comment about the attachment.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Event_Attachment_CategoryObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Attachment Categories.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.

Request_Return_from_Leave_Event.description: Element for the attachments pertaining to a Event entered through a web service.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Event Attachments.

description: Contains Request Return from Leave Event data.
